content: Nice article here, Charles. I followed Bruce Lee for a good long while in my younger years and was always blown away with how much belief he had in himself. He had no doubt, as his letter said, that he would achieve what he wanted to achieve. In re-reading this, it makes me reflect on how visualisation comes about. Often, you might try and visualise something you want material or others wise but find it to be elusive. Other things you may find very easy to visualise. Perhaps, what we find easier to visualise in terms of things we desire (again, material and non-material) might help us to find what we want to do and be in life?
